captions.text:
Lads, finish off whatever you're doing and
listen up while you do it. I think today is

a good challenge, they'll be organised, they'll
be technically strong, they'll be a better

team than you've played before because they're
used to playing together. So now is the time

when all the work that we've done during the
week, and all the work we've done in previous

weeks on how we play, has to stand up. Every
one of you has to aim to be the best player

on the pitch. Full backs, Kamal very important,
go high but not too high too early change

is an element of surprise. Liam, dictate the
game. Make sure that everything goes through

you, you are the number four so you have to
have the responsibility. Abu, you are more

the box to box player, up and down helping
us regaining possession. Once you've done

that, think about the second phase which is
securing possession.
Excellent Liam. Get in the box!
Take him on, take him on!
Yes!
Stay on it Liam, stay on it Liam! Don't get beat!
Great movement, really well played.

Lads you've
played okay, but when we get into the attacking

third it's a little bit soft and passive Mehdi
travels and he travels and there's nothing

on. We get to a point where you think, I'm
either hitting a diagonal or I'm giving it

to Curtis or I'm giving it to Ben. They've
not hurt us through good play, it's when we

lose it they hurt the gaps that we've left.
Okay, so we've got to be better in possession

so that we've got a better purpose about us.
That's all that I'd say.
Well played, well played.
Come on, keep it going boys!
Don't let them out easy boys.
Oh here we go!
Yes!
Three, three!
What a lovely turn that is.
Sam go to the ball, go to the ball!
Don't dive in!
Brilliant Sam!
You've done incredibly well against a

good academy side there, to come back from
3-1 down to win. But, there's winning which

is a great feeling and then there is progress
and we've got to make progress as well. Technical

understanding, tactical understanding, decision
making at times, the things that are going

to get you the pro-contract I think we can
improve more. The goals we conceded are really

poor goals but in the second half you had
a purpose to what you were doing loads of

positive things to say in that we've scored
5 goals against a Premier League academy side

but also we need to see you learning quicker
in terms of our defensive side of things.

To really build your reputation as a team,
it's alright to be a winning team but you

need to be professional players as well and
have professional habits and that's the next
step for us all.
Well done boys.

title: Nike Academy: QPR - Big Opposition, Bigger Opportunity
